ainmear_fireann.note: From Scottish Natural Heritage's Faclan Nàdair.

Info: The Gaelic name 'breabadair' means 'weaver' and fìdhleir na casan fada means fiddler with the long legs. Also traditionally known as Alasdair Mòr nam pollagan (Big Alasdair of the ponds) and snàthad an duine mhairbh (dead man's needles).
